title: ## Reading List: Retrieval-Based Language Models (2023 and Earlier
This list includes articles about retrieval systems, language models, and their intersection, focusing on retrieval-based language models. It covers reviews, research papers, and surveys
**Retrieval Systems:**
**"Dense Passage Retrieval for Open-Domain Question Answering"** by Karpukhin et al
- Introduces dense passage retrieval, a key technique for retrieval-based language models
**"Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Knowledge-Intensive NLP Tasks"** by Lewis et al
- Explores the use of retrieval in language generation tasks
**"Efficient and Effective Passage Retrieval for Open-Domain Question Answering"** by Lee et al
- Discusses efficient retrieval methods for open-domain question answering
**"A Survey of Text Retrieval Techniques"** by Baeza-Yates & Ribeiro-Neto
- Provides a comprehensive overview of text retrieval techniques
**"Neural Networks for Information Retrieval: A Survey"** by Xiong et al
- Reviews the application of neural networks in information retrieval
**Language Models:**
- Introduces the Transformer architecture, a key component of many modern language models
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** by Devlin et al
- Presents BERT, a powerful language model for various NLP tasks
**"GPT-3: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"** by Brown et al
- Introduces GPT-3, a large language model capable of few-shot learning
**"A Survey of Large Language Models"** by Zhang et al
- Provides a comprehensive overview of large language models
**"Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"** by Brown et al
- Explores the capabilities of large language models for few-shot learning
**Retrieval-Based Language Models:**
**"Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Knowledge-Intensive NLP Tasks"** by Lewis et al
- Explores the use of retrieval in language generation tasks
**"Real-Time Dense Passage Retrieval for Open-Domain Question Answering"** by Karpukhin et al
- Presents a real-time dense passage retrieval system for open-domain question answering
**"Dense Passage Retrieval for Open-Domain Question Answering"** by Karpukhin et al
- Introduces dense passage retrieval, a key technique for retrieval-based language models
**"Retrieval-Augmented Language Models"** by Guu et al
- Discusses the benefits of combining retrieval and language models
